definition[0]: to completely destroy something or make something disappear
example[0]: houses swept away by the floods
example[1]: A sudden feeling of grief swept all my anger away.
definition[1]: if you are swept away or swept along by something, you are so excited that you do not think clearly or you forget about other things
example[2]: We couldn’t help being swept away by Bette’s enthusiasm.
example[3]: Nineteenth-century scientists were swept along on the tide of Darwin’s theories.
explanation[0]: Sweep away or sweep along is usually passive in this meaning
